definition: to withdraw to the second line of duty/to resign from a leading post (and assume an advisory post)
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Executives from two firms attest that its representatives take a back seat at board meetings.
sentences.chinese: 兩個公司的主管認可中投代表在董事會議中退居二線。

sentences.english: My beautiful here, "second line" can not compete in the market.
sentences.chinese: 我的漂亮在這兒“退居二線”無法參與市場競爭。

sentences.english: Sovereign debt concerns are also being put on the back burner.
sentences.chinese: 主權債務危機同樣“退居二線”。

sentences.english: He works enthusiastically as ever even though he has retired from the leading post.
sentences.chinese: 儘管己退居二線，他的工作熱情絲毫不減。

sentences.english: His withdrawal to the second line of duty crossed up the whole arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 他退居二線打亂了整個安排。

sentences.english: Microsoft expects to decommission the older servers by the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 微軟則計劃在今年底讓老的服務器退居二線。

sentences.english: Senior army leaders reportedly told guests that the military supremo was readying to take a back seat.
sentences.chinese: 據說軍隊高級領導人透露，丹瑞已經決定退居二線。

sentences.english: Retiring of the two importers of Tag data from old plugins.
sentences.chinese: 退居二線的老插件標籤數據的兩個入口。
